description: The type of data entry control or structure that should be used to render the item.

element.comment: Different controls may be appropriate for different item types.  It is up to the system rendering a questionnaire as to what controls it will support and for which data types.  See additional guidance and examples in the [SDC implementation guide](http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/sdc/rendering.html#itemControl).
element.definition: The type of data entry control or structure that should be used to render the item.
element.short: E.g. Fly-over, Table, Checkbox, Combo-box, Lookup, etc.

binding.description: User interface controls or widgets used for questionnaire items.

element.requirements: The data type is CodeableConcept to allow for additional codings that might provide finer-grained control information or specification of specific controls in different rendering environments.  CodeableConcept.text is generally unnecessary for this element and should not be sent alone as the use-case for this element is for computable interpretation by rendering engines.

name: itemControl

element.comment: Different controls may be appropriate for different item types.  It is up to the system rendering a questionnaire as to what controls it will support and for which data types.  See additional guidance and examples in the [SDC implementation guide](http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/sdc/rendering.html#itemControl).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The type of data entry control or structure that should be used to render the item.
element.short: E.g. Fly-over, Table, Checkbox, Combo-box, Lookup, etc.

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

binding.description: User interface controls or widgets used for questionnaire items.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
element.requirements: The data type is CodeableConcept to allow for additional codings that might provide finer-grained control information or specification of specific controls in different rendering environments.  CodeableConcept.text is generally unnecessary for this element and should not be sent alone as the use-case for this element is for computable interpretation by rendering engines.
